page.title: 14CHRIST CHURCH ARMLEY LEEDS
page.content: The church, built in 1872, was completely modernised internally in 1984. A number of parishoners had been seriously questioning the future of the church, but it was the present vicar who put forward the ideas which were eventually acted upon. To cut the high costs of heating, the ceiling was lowered and the nave was divided so that 250 to 350 seats can still be used. The side aisles and rear nave are separate sections that include kitchen and toilets with access for disabled. Now the building can more ably cater for a variety of uses for 7 days a week. Activities include a playgroup, children's clubs, committee and prayer meetings and social events, as well as the normal services.
